steps.title: Pour each yolk into a separate compartment of a large ice cube tray or freeze together in a small container with a lid.
steps.content: Pour each yolk into a separate compartment of a large ice cube tray or freeze together in a small container with a lid.

steps.title: Cover the ice cube tray with a freezer bag.
steps.content: Cover the ice cube tray with a freezer bag.

steps.title: Place in the freezer.
steps.content: Place in the freezer. Use within the month.

steps.title: Put the egg yolks into a small container.
steps.content: Put the egg yolks into a small container.

steps.title: Cover the yolks with either water or a small amount of melted butter.
steps.content: Cover the yolks with either water or a small amount of melted butter.

steps.title: Put a lid on the container and place the container in the refrigerator.
steps.content: Put a lid on the container and place the container in the refrigerator. Stored in this way, the egg yolks will keep for up to 5 days, refrigerated. Drain the water before using the egg yolks in your recipe.
